intro: Cicerbita cyanea var. lutea, commonly known as the yellow celandine, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Papaveraceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland areas and thrives in temperate climates. It produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. The yellow celandine is often found in Europe and parts of Asia, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
